intro: Amauropelta basisceletica, commonly known as the broad-leafed fern, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery fronds. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often near streams or in dense forests. Its spores are released from sporangia located on the underside of the fronds. The botanical features of Amauropelta basisceletica make it an important component of understory vegetation in its native habitats.
